info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 2:03PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING EAST THROUGH THE SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS AND SNAKE RIVER PLAIN THROUGH 4 PM MDT... At 159 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Ucon to near Almo, moving east at 25 mph. Individuals traveling along Interstate 84, 86, and 15 through 4 PM MDT should be prepared for significantly reduced visibility below 1/4 mile in a narrow band of intense snowfall and reduce speeds as appropriate. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Blackfoot, American Falls, Driggs, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swan Valley, Malta, Ririe Reservoir, Neeley, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, Blackfoot Reservoir, northern Palisades Reservoir, eastern American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Ammon, Shelley and Victor. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this band of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow.
